SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
ELEVATE DOCUMENTATION
Import Recurring Donations

Now that you've prepared your import file, learn how to move your recurring donations to Elevate.

NOTE Salesforce is retiring the Elevate family of products. This affects Elevate Advanced Edition, Elevate Power of Us Editions, and all add-ons. As part of this product retirement, the ability to renew subscriptions to this product will end on October 1, 2023, and we anticipate that the product will be deactivated on or after October 1, 2024.
Import a Test File
Before you import tens, hundreds, or thousands of records, test your import file and verify the results to confirm your full file will process smoothly.
Import the Full File
Now that you verified the format of the import file through a successful test with a subset of your data, import the remainder of your file.
Check the Full Import
Check the full report to understand which files were imported successfully and which failed.
Stop Processing with Legacy Provider
Once you've completed your import, make sure your constituents aren't charged by Elevate as well as your legacy service provider.
Close or Delete Open Opportunities
Once you've completed your import, close or delete any existing open Opportunities that are related to Elevate-connected Recurring Donations.
Considerations for Importing Large Data Sets
Scheduled rollup jobs can cause errors when importing a large data set that takes several hours to process.
Import a Test File

Before you import tens, hundreds, or thousands of records, test your import file and verify the results to confirm your full file will process smoothly.

To test your import:

Move 5-10 records to a new CSV file.

Follow the instructions in Import the Full File to import the test file.

Verify the import and integration with Salesforce ran as expected by reviewing the records in the Success file. Learn more about reviewing results in Explore Results Files and NPSP Error Log.

Find the Recurring Donation record in Elevate.

Confirm the Elevate record contains the information you expected.

Click View in Salesforce to confirm the Elevate record is connected to the correct Salesforce Recurring Donation record.

If any records weren't successfully created in Salesforce, follow the instructions in Troubleshoot Import Integration Issues to correct the issues.

Repeat these steps for every record in your test file.

If your import produced a Failure file, fix the errors and run the test import again until all of the records are successfully imported.

Apply any fixes you made to the test file to the full file.

If your full import file contains a significant number of records, you may want to run another test with 10% of the records from the full file.

Import the Full File

Now that you verified the format of the import file through a successful test with a subset of your data, import the remainder of your file.

IMPORTANT

Do not import your entire file unless you've completed a test import. See Import a Test File for more information.

If you have a large number of records to import, see Considerations for Importing Large Data Sets.

NOTE You can instead import using API endpoints. Learn more in Commitments Import (POST) API - Create a File Import Session, Commitments Import (PATCH) API - Start a File Import Session, and Commitments Import (GET) API - Get a File Import Session.

Go to Payments Management | Imports.

Click Import Recurring Donations.

Find and select your CSV file.

Select the Payment Gateway.

Click Import.

The Status column displays one of these values:

Processing...
The import is running.
Failed
Elevate can't process the import file. Make sure your file is correctly saved as a CSV.
Processed
The import is complete and Elevate imported some or all of the records in your file.
Check the Full Import

Check the full report to understand which files were imported successfully and which failed.

The processed row has a linked Success file for the records that were imported, and if applicable, a link for a Failure file that contains records that failed to import. Read more about the results files and how to troubleshoot common issues in Review Import Results.

Here's a short summary of how to check the full import:

If you see a Failure file associated with your import, download it to review and fix the errors. Then, remove the leading column that contains the error message, save it as a CSV, and re-import the corrected CSV file.

Download the Success file and spot check the imported records for accuracy in Elevate as well as in Salesforce.

In Salesforce, check the Error Log for imported records that didn't get created in Salesforce. See Troubleshoot Import Integration Issues for more information.

NOTE If you see an error in the Salesforce Error Log that reads "Valid Payment Methods for an active Elevate-connected Recurring Donation are Credit Card or ACH.", you need to update a picklist field value in Salesforce. For the Payment Method field on the Recurring Donation object, update the API Name for the ACH value from ACH/EFT to ACH.
Stop Processing with Legacy Provider

Once you've completed your import, make sure your constituents aren't charged by Elevate as well as your legacy service provider.

Turn off recurring donation processing for your legacy services provider for the transactions that moved to Elevate or contact your legacy service provider to do so.

Close or Delete Open Opportunities

Once you've completed your import, close or delete any existing open Opportunities that are related to Elevate-connected Recurring Donations.

Otherwise, when Elevate processes the next installment, there will be a duplicate Opportunity for the same installment.

Create a report to locate open Opportunities related to Elevate-connected Recurring Donations:Create a report using the Opportunities and Recurring Donation report type.

Create a report using the Opportunities and Recurring Donation report type.

Make the following adjustments the report Filters:

Show Me = All opportunities.

Close Date = All Time.

Opportunity Status = Open.

Probability = All.

Elevate Recurring Id not equal to blank.

Add the Opportunity ID column.

Add or remove additional columns as needed.

Save the report.

Use the report data along with Salesforce Data Loader or a similar data manipulation tool to update or delete the Opportunity records.

Considerations for Importing Large Data Sets

Scheduled rollup jobs can cause errors when importing a large data set that takes several hours to process.

To avoid rollup errors when importing a large data set, delete the Enhanced Recurring Donation and Customizable Rollup batch jobs prior to starting the import process.

In Setup, go to Scheduled Jobs.

Click Del next to these Scheduled Jobs:

All Scheduled Jobs with "Customizable Rollups" in the name. For example, NPSP 02A - Customizable Rollups - Contact Hard Credit.

NPSP 06 - Enhanced Recurring Donation Updates.

Each time you delete a Scheduled Job, click OK in the popup window.

After you complete the full Recurring Donation import, recreate the Scheduled Jobs by clicking the NPSP Settings tab or launching it from the App Launcher. Loading the NPSP Settings page recreates all the deleted NPSP Scheduled Jobs.
